image.altText: A graphic featuring a selection of comments from Brand Army.

props.synopsis: The rise of social media and child influencers has brought with it a murky underworld where men lust over kids in private chat channels and innocent images become deepfake pornography.

title.children: Adult 'fans' are paying $30 a month to see photos of a young girl. Chatting with her costs more

image.altText: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi clasping his hands over his chest

props.synopsis: An Iranian official says the lives of Mr Raisi and Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian are "at risk following the helicopter crash".

title.children: Helicopter carrying president of Iran crashes, search teams yet to find wreck

image.altText: A hand holds money in Darwin.

props.synopsis: A new ASIC report says banks aren't doing what the law says they must do to help customers in trouble, as the proportion of borrowers in strife rises due to high interest rates, rocketing rents and increases in the cost of living.

title.children: A new report says some banks are 'abandoning' customers who ask for assistance

image.altText: Adelaide pastor Dion Sternberg in his kitchen.

props.synopsis: Power companies are skirting their obligations to warn households about major changes to the way they are charged for electricity courtesy of a "loophole" in Australia's energy rules.

title.children: 'Loophole' allows energy companies to change household power tariffs without their knowledge

image.altText: PROXY illustration flowers in brain

props.synopsis: Considering the rise in mental health crises in young women, a new approach is desperately needed.

title.children: Why are girls suffering so much right now? The problem is bigger than you think

image.altText: A man in a bright yellow T-shirt and jeans looks happy with hands up standing in a commercial kitchen that is blue themed.

props.synopsis: Shaun Christie-David is a radical restaurateur who's employing the "unemployable" and giving away thousands of free meals.

title.children: He can't cook, but Shaun Christie-David's restaurants are changing lives one meal at a time.

image.altText: A pregnant woman works at her desk.

props.synopsis: Buried in the federal budget papers is a figure that saves the bottom line almost half a billion dollars, but instead of being a happy story it reflects a demographic freight train coming for our country.

title.children: Federal budget savings are usually good news, but in this case it reflects a deep and worrying problem

image.altText: A group of Chinese men sitting on the boat.

props.synopsis: A growing number of people are trying to leave China — some risking their lives at sea or in the jungle — as the country's political and economic future remains uncertain.

title.children: How the Chinese version of TikTok tempted 10 men to risk their lives coming to Australia

image.altText: A sign on top of a building reads "lendlease".

props.synopsis: Corporate whistleblower Tony Watson says a small tweak to current whistleblower protection laws would significantly reduce his risk. Seven months on, nothing has changed.

title.children: Whistleblower's decision to speak out arguably netted the ATO millions, but it came at a huge personal cost

image.altText: A man sits on a couch holding a vile of Ozempic

props.synopsis: Australia's major health insurers are at odds over how to treat the diabetes and weight loss medication Ozempic, with one insurer slashing benefits amid a worldwide shortage.

title.children: Ozempic is splitting Australia's major private health insurers, and people like Michael are in the crosshairs

image.altText: nsw police surround a man on the floor after an allaged stabbing in sydney

props.synopsis: The incident unfolded just after 1pm when a 33-year-old man wielding a knife about 30 centimetres long confronted two police officers on traffic duties near Hyde Park, allegedly stabbing one of them multiple times in the head.

title.children: Police officer stabbed in the head in Sydney CBD chased alleged attacker before arresting him

image.altText: Mounted police officers on horses in the middle of a demonstration.

props.synopsis: Several people have been arrested after a clash between a pro-Palestinian rally and a pro-Israeli rally in Melbourne's CBD on Sunday.

title.children: Six arrested after pro-Israel and pro-Palestinian demonstrations meet in Melbourne's CBD

image.altText: An aerial view of building foundations.

props.synopsis: Yarra Bend Lunatic Asylum was demolished and buried in the 1920s but archaeologists now believe more of it still exists beneath the surface than they previously thought.

title.children: Beneath netball courts in Melbourne's inner suburbs lies one of Victoria's most significant archaeological sites

image.altText: A man in a labcoat with a brown vial of liquid

props.synopsis: The richest quartile of Australians drink 33.8 per cent more alcohol than the poorest quartile, the wastewater study finds.

title.children: Australians are drinking less alcohol but rich people drink the most, scientists find

image.altText: Smoke rises over city of Noumea, in New Caledonia.

props.synopsis: At least six people are dead as a result of protests in New Caledonia, after Paris approved a constitutional amendment that some fear will dilute the voting power of the Indigenous Kanak.

title.children: Why the French response in New Caledonia risks helping China

image.altText: A bearded man with black-rimmed glasses

props.synopsis: Growing up queer informed Dr James Allen’s approach to gay health. He says a suicide register is needed for LGBTQIA+ deaths to track the extent of the problem.

title.children: Dr James Allen lost two patients to suicide at the height of COVID, triggering his own mental health crisis

image.altText: A composite image of NRL players Mark Nicholls, Cameron Munster and Nicho Hynes.

props.synopsis: Another Magic Round delivers action aplenty, with Cameron Munster's worrisome injury, some hip-drop drama and more proof the Sharks are the real deal. Here's this week's NRL Round-Up.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Magic Round gives us Munny's niggle and Nicholls's new nickname

image.altText: A split image shows a woman with child in yellow jumper, an older woman with pink lipstick, and a young woman with auburn hair

props.synopsis: We asked Australians for their thoughts on cost-of-living measures unveiled in the federal budget. Among thousands of submissions, there's an overwhelming sense of despair.

title.children: What happens when the money runs out? Australians share their thoughts on the 'cost-of-living' budget

image.altText: Image of a man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Joe McDowell, an Australian man who was injured in a deadly shooting in central Afghanistan, is now in a stable condition in hospital.

title.children: Australian injured in Afghanistan shooting in stable condition in hospital

image.altText: A parachute in the blue sky.

props.synopsis: Six members of a Sydney-based army unit that prepares parachutes for military exercises tested positive to illicit drugs just days before special forces soldier Jack Fitzgibbon was killed in a training jump.

title.children: Members of army unit that prepares parachutes tested positive for drugs days before fatal jump

image.altText: Cameron Munster walks with two of Melbourne Storm's medical staff after being injured during Magic Round.

props.synopsis: Melbourne and Queensland superstar Cameron Munster aggravates his groin injury in the Storm's thumping win over Parramatta, casting his State of Origin participation into doubt.

title.children: Cameron Munster hobbles off with groin injury in Storm's thumping win over Eels

image.altText: GettyImages-2153135430

props.synopsis: The Power pull off a great escape with a final-second goal to beat the Hawks, as the Eagles stun the Demons in Perth thanks to some Harley Reid brilliance.

title.children: Eagles cause huge upset thanks to Reid brilliance, as Power break Hawk hearts in final second

image.altText: An image of two shells on a white background

props.synopsis: NSW-based artist Sally Clarke spent her formative years on the Cocos (Keeling) Islands and amassed a vast shell collection. Forty years later, she wants to return what she took.

title.children: Growing up in tropical paradise, Sally amassed a large shell collection. Now she's righting the 'crime of the past'

image.altText: Close-up shot of West Coast forward Tyler Brockman carrying the football.

props.synopsis: Police charge West Coast Eagles forward Tyler Brockman, alleging he fled after crashing his ute into a light post in Geraldton.

title.children: West Coast Eagles recruit charged after allegedly fleeing scene of ute crash

image.altText: An F1 race in action, with the leader exiting a chicane, with second and third place following closely

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has held off a surging Lando Norris to extend his lead in the world championship, as McLaren's resurgence to the front of the Formula 1 grid continues.

title.children: Verstappen clings on to beat Norris by less than a second in Italy

image.altText: The Doctor puts a hand up while leaning against a wall with Ruby, right, doing the same. Both look to the camera.

props.synopsis: We are happy to report the new Doctor, played by Ncuti Gatwa, goes beyond being tokenistic Black and gay and that it's very good. But that's not all that's new to streaming this month.

title.children: The new Dr Who is very Black and gay and it's what we deserve

image.altText: A burnt-out car sits next to a burning car with flames and black smoke pouring from it on a motorway surrounded by green trees

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the Australian Defence Force is ready to fly to New Caledonia once the situation is safe, as France moves to quash deadly riots.

title.children: 'Risk the worst': France launches campaigns against independence strongholds amid violent riots in New Caledonia

image.altText: A brown granular powder in a plastic bag beside a ruler.

props.synopsis: Canberra's drug-checking site issues a red community notice for N-pyrrolidino protonitazene after identifying the dangerous synthetic opioid in granular brown powder presented for testing.

title.children: 'A drug nobody should be using': CanTEST finds dangerous synthetic opioid in Canberra for the first time

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

props.synopsis: Last week's federal budget revealed a plan to force energy retailers to offer cheaper deals for customers with just a click, preventing contracts automatically rolling over to higher-cost deals.

title.children: The government wants to force energy retailers to give you their cheapest deal with just 'one click'

image.altText: A for lease sign at a picket fence

props.synopsis: Australia's rental vacancy rate hit a record low recently. But what is the vacancy rate actually signifying? And could an unoccupied home tax help to solve our housing crisis?

title.children: What's the link between low rental vacancy rates, housing crises, and unoccupied home taxes?

image.altText: Sarah stands in front of a small pond

props.synopsis: What do you do when the traditional turf lawn isn't quite cutting it anymore? Rip it out and start again — this time with something other than lush green lines in mind.

title.children: Sarah killed her front lawn. She's never been happier or more relaxed

image.altText: A man in blue shirt smiling.

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces says that troops have retrieved the body of hostage Ron Benjamin from the war-torn Gaza Strip after he was "murdered" during the October 7 Hamas attack.

title.children: Body of Israeli hostage Ron Benjamin recovered from Gaza, says IDF

image.altText: Black and grey striped kitten looks up at the camera from behind a white surface

props.synopsis: Broader adoption of keeping cats safe at home would have large benefits for cat welfare, human health, local wildlife and even the economy. So, should cat owners be required to keep their pets contained to their property?

title.children: Keeping pet cats indoors would save millions of native animals and billions of dollars. So what's stopping us?
